LongDescription: A redundant emergency shutdown system for fusion reactors, supplementing the built-in shutdown system which can fail when the module itself is heavily damaged.  Significantly reduces the probability of a reactor overload occurring.
FlavorText:
Essentially, an additional vacuum vessel for the tokamak combined with an additional sleeve for dire situations. Surprisingly, maintainence is minimal, leading to many reactor personnel to refer to the redundant failsafe as the "magic rod" since it never seems to experience any kind of malfunction.

Obviously, if the situation is getting out of hand and the heat is skyrocketing, you're still going to be facing down a reactor overload. The manual usually ends with a simple "good luck" when that starts to happen.

- I. Parker, CMC
